title: Worst Practice
body: At 56 I have seen many GP's. I also spent 20 years in the NHS as a nurse. This practice has the worst doctors I have ever come across. One I saw twice who was rude, uninformed, unhelpful and dismissive. I have now left and found far better and kinder GP's .

title: Great with my daughter.
body: They are all very good with my daughter who has L/D. She can get very anxious before visits but she loves coming to see the nurses.

title: Excellent care
body:
Very well organised and efficient.
Cheery welcome and spot on appointment time. The information was clear but I felt that I could have asked questions

title: Great service
body: Attended for an ECG today. Had been shielding for many months, and was very anxious about attending. Young lady put me completely at ease, spoke to me calmly, and was very friendly and professional. First class service. Also social distancing was completely maintained within the hospital, with one way in and one out of the place. Signage everywhere to keep left, and one way arrows. Well done County Hospital.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Thank you so much to the Social Prescriber at the practice. I am very grateful for all the help they have given me. I feel they went above and beyond in order to sort out my situation, excellent service but especially the way the Social Prescriber had arranged everything and I felt reassured that everything would be dealt with.

title: Best Practice
body: I have moved around the country a lot for work and can honestly say that this is by far the best practice I have experienced. It's not great that everyone in the waiting area can hear the receptionists talking to patients there or over the phone and one of the practice nurses is perhaps in the wrong profession, but the doctors are amazing. They never make you feel like they don't have time for you and often go out of their way to get you the help you need. I have been able to get emergency appointments a couple of times when needed and the processing of prescriptions is very efficient too. I will be very sad to move on and have to take my chances with a new practice!

title: Poor practice
body: The early intervention team did not help at all with my issues. I did not like anything about the service offered when I went to see them in a session. I didn’t get the most out of my session with no advice given or help. I disliked the counselling options available to help me deal with my anxiety. The early intervention team did not read my information and I was unimpressed with the level of care.

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good practice
body: Went to surgery for flu injection. Very professional from entry to leaving surgery very polite and professional staff

title: Priceless Service
body: I went to the Lady Sobell Unit for a colonoscopy. The staff were understanding, caring and so efficient. They made me comfortable under what were not very pleasant circumstances. They listened to what I had to say and did everything to make my visit a good one. Before I left the doctor sat down with me to explain what happens next and give me my notes and other written information. It's this that makes our N.H.S. the health service envied by the rest of the world. Thank you

title: Very Good Service.
body: Attended on the 6th October to have laser treatment to both my eyes.  All staff were polite, friendly and the doctor I saw put my mind at rest by explaining what treatment I was to have and what would happen.  Overall a very good experience with friendly caring staff.

title: Caring Team
body: Appointment arranged swiftly by receptionist; re-assured by friendly and professional consultation face to face (or mask to mask actually!) with GP.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: Appointments are available without difficulty and the medical and admin staff are helpful and efficient.

title: Five elms medical practice
body: There is loads of receptionists at this practice but they just sit around ignoring the phone, on a good day you will get through after 20 mins of listening to a recorded message of wait a moment or it will ring for 40 minutes and then you get cut off, how anyone actually gets through to make an appointment beats me, plus if you do ever get through the receptionists don’t understand what you are trying to convey, this is my old Dads surgery and I have to deal with them for him and it’s an awful experience just to try to talk to anyone, I think that they should employ new receptionists that want to answer the phone and actually care about the poor people trying to get through to make an appointment and not leave them to listen to an automated message for 20 minutes which happens every time I call, avoid this surgery for your health and sanity’s sake at all costs

title: Excellent attention
body: Excellent attention from the Nurses and ALL the Cardiac Team at my recent Pacemaker procedure.     Beautifully organised and one felt very cared for and safe.     The surgeon and all the team were very organised and professional.     A very good experience except, sadly, from the Reception!

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible service
body: I went to try and join these doctors for personal reasons and had emailed them twice to make sure I was in catchment area. Walked to practice not well and the rude receptionist refused me saying I wasn't in the catchment area. Returned home emailed them again to be told I was in catchment area, did not return I have several illnesses and was told the Dr's are fantastic here shame the receptionists are so rude and arrogant they really let the practice down and the NHS.. Please retrain them with people skills

title: Amazing staff in outpatient blood test department
body: My surgery advised they had e-mailed a blood test form to EGH and on arrival for my appointment there was no sign of any blood test form ever being received. The receptionist was amazing and after a lot of exchanges with my useless surgery the receptionist fitted me in the following day as she was aware I had waited over 3 weeks for the original appointment. The nurse who subsequently took my bloods was gentle, friendly and welcoming. After shielding until August they at least went above and beyond with my anxiety levels - more than could be said for my surgery !!!

title: Infuriating and in pain
body: get sent a text message and letter to try to book an appointment for an ultrasound. I have spent 4 days and numerous hours on hold waiting to speak to someone. The letter states that my referral will be returned to my GP if I don't make contact within 7 days of the letter being written. The letter has taken 3 days to get to me dated 05/oct 20 I received it 08/10/20. I can't answer calls from unknown numbers I work in a dr's surgery and can only take urgent calls. I have been on the phone from 8am until 5pm and been on hold for 15 mins each time and then get asked to leave a message. I have left a message asking for an appointment at my local centre at any time and a letter to be sent. I have been trying to confirm that this has happened at half hourly slots through out the day and still received no answer. If my referral gets returned to my GP I will be making a formal complaint. I understand that calls are busier during the covid outbreak so expect a bit of understanding in return.

title: Very good practice
body: LHGP have been my GP practice for around 15 years. I was very lucky when I moved house to find a place which was still just yards inside their catchment area! Every time I have been there I have had good treatment, and I have nothing but good words to say about them. Appointments are always a difficult subject at any practice, but any time I have really been in need they have always been able to help. Plus nowadays the Patient Access system has made routine appointments much easier. Thank you to everybody at the practice.

title: Flu jab well-organised
body: My wife and I had our flu jabs and the whole procedure was conducted with care, efficiency, courtesy and with Covid-19 restrictions safely in place. We were in and out within 3 minutes. Well done and thank you!

title: Wonderful friendly prompt help from all staff
body: My husband and I have Just joined this surgery.  What great service we have both received.  We can get through easily on the phone unlike our previous surgery, all staff have been friendly and very helpful.  Unlike our previous surgery, where you are on hold for long periods of time for example I had made and baked 2 cakes before my last surgery decided to answer my call, and then told me to phone back the following week!!! We are so glad to have changed to Asquith. Keep up the good work.  Thank you everyone

title: Great service
body: The GP I saw was brilliant (A.M.), thorough and helpful. V grateful to get this level of care despite the pandemic. I booked online and had a telephone call and an appointment, thanks! Would be great to have some more online services if possible, maybe econsults or increased patient access?

title: Excellent service!
body:
Both my wife and I had appointments to attend the 'Flu clinic on a Saturday morning at 10:40, we got there a few minutes early and there was no queue we were instructed by reception where to go and a minute or so later we had had our injections and followed the directions to exit, couldn't have been simpler.
Plus the nurse who performed the task was extremely pleasant and efficient. Carry on the good work.

title: Awful Receptionist
body:
Recently I have registered to this surgery. First contact face to face with the receptionist was very pleasant, though when I have called to ask more details about my registration, the receptionist started to be super rude and raised her voice. Clearly she was not in the mood to give me information!

Before I have decided to register to this practice I have red all the reviews, and people were saying that the doctors are brilliant, but the way the receptionist is behaving is awful.

I hopped it is not true. Unfortunately, it is. Ruined my day!

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Gone downhill quicker than an Olympic skier
body: Trying to get through by phone is a nightmare. From 8am constantly engaged with no queuing system, then it shuts down for 2hrs during the day, then you have restrictions on what time you call for results/prescriptions etc and if you are lucky enough to get through wanting an appointment it will be around 3 weeks time, when hopefully you're better or dead. The customer service staff need a lesson in being less cheeky and more courteous and realize that every person isn't as proficient as them with IT tech. After 30 yrs here I can say the Doctors and nurses are generally very good but the overall running of this surgery has a lot to be desired.

title: I had great care.
body:
on 23rd September I was taken to A&E suffering from multiple rheumatoid arthritis joint flare ups, unable to move myself, and had a fall at home. I was on the floor for 2 hrs before my son came home. Following A&E I was moved to Oken Ward, and 2 days later I was moved to Victoria Ward and i stayed there for 2 weeks until discharge on 8th Oct 2020. I would like to thank the doctors and nurses, and support services, on Oken Ward, and in particular, Victoria Ward. I was on strong iv antibiotics throughout my stay to get things back to normal. Unfortunately I still couldn't go home because INR and sodium levels were low. I have been well looked after on VictoriaWard, the nurses do not stop. They are constantly on the go, but they are committed and dedicated, and always act in a professional way in order to give me the best care I can get in order I can go home. It has been a pleasure to have been treated by such caring individuals and I am in no doubt that this has helped me get back on my feet in as quick a time as possible. Physio therapists helped me to take small steps to start with and helped me to be able to walk the corridor that runs through the ward. I can honestly say that Victoria Ward has been the best ward that i have been an in-patient on. Over the years I've been on several wards although I'm not particularly elderley. In addition, the catering |I have found to be extremely good. I particularly liked the macaroni cheese, and the soups.  The porridge is also excellent. So no complaints from me on that score. 
In conclusion, I am so happy that Warwick Hospital is my local hospital. An excellent hospital with excellent staff.
Thumbs up to South Warwickshire Hospital Trust..

Thank you.

title: fantastic staff and care
body: Thanks to all staff on ward 14 had my op 8th Oct 2020 all staff are brilliant from start to finish  everybody his kind and helpful thanks now home and resting thanks againBeryl Wilson x

title: Not very understanding
body: Receptionist very unhelpfull when told she was being unreasonable told if I raised my voice would be cut off

title: Jewel in the Crown
body: Excellent practice, professional and caring, never had wait a long time to see a doctor or nurse. Difficult to find a better run practice within South East I believe!

title: Rude receptionists and poor service.
body: The receptionsts at this surgery must be the rudest ever. I am sure if I spoke to them they way they speak to people, well, I would be told to leave. On top of that todat I am given a form for a blood test. Two of the locations no longer provide a Phlebotomy service.  The other I find out is by appoitment. Only found this out when the form states a walk in service is provided, when I arrive there, the reception staff inform me its by appoitment only. This surgery is totally incompetent.

title: Great Service
body:
I had to have Hernia Repaired and went to see General Surgery. From the Time of consultation to date for the surgery was very short. Pleasantly surprised.
On the day of the surgery the team at Day Surgery and the Consultants surgery team were brilliant. 100 out of 100. Everything explained through out the process.
My first experience of NHS surgery was very pleasant.

title: Superb Treatment
body: I've had 5 telephone consultations and 1 video consultation since the pandemic began. I've also had the flu jab and a stitch removed, both at the health centre. On each occasion the receptionists, nurse practitioners and doctors have been superb. I can't recommend them highly enough.

title: Rude. Horrible. Will not visit again.
body: My experience at this practice is truly horrific despite not actually attending the practice. Many patients were waiting by the door as it was locked due to coronavirus yet none of the staff were helpful. There was no level of patient care at all. Staff could see us standing outside the door yet noone came an offered help. Noone responded even when knocking. Someone then knocked continuously after standing there for a while with no response when one reception member finally came out. Not to help though! To shout for knocking so much. Had they been helpful and responded people would not feel the need to knock that much. They wouldn't have had to wait for ages for help. Why be in a patient facing role if you have no customer service skills or basic levels of patient care. Working in the NHS one of the main things we should be is caring towards patients. Your staff were not. I believe you should rethink your patient facing staff and offer them more training in how to care about patients more. To be waiting for ages without no acknowledgement or help is not expected from someone dealing with patients at all. There was also no patience or understanding. No help. Just shouted at for knocking. No sorry how can we help. No how can we help. Just shouted at for knocking.

title: Someone needs to learn how to run a practice!
body: I have had so many problems with this practice to the point i am now looking for a new practice which is a shame because the doctors are great but the admin staff are awful! I have asked on numerous times to speak to the practice manager and always get excuse after excuse shes on holiday shes out with a patient and have left my number but she never calls back at this point im guessing this person doesnt exist! The receptionists are always rude and trying to get an appointment is like trying to find water in the desert (and yes it was like this before covid) you start calling at 8am when they open and get put straight into a queue of 20 people in front if you have the will to wait you finally get through to be told no more appointments call again tomorrow and so you try again only for the same result the next day and the next and god forbid you ask for an appointment in the future this doctors seem to deal with appointments day by day ONLY! As i mentioned if you ever do get to see a doctor they are really really nice and have been great with my little girl, although dont expect to see the same doctor twice if you like to deal with 1 doctor. All in all i would avoid this doctors at all costs if possible!! And i hope to get away soon myself!

title: The best practice
body: This is certainly the best practice I have ever had.  Everyone is very kind and competent, receptionists, doctors, EVERYONE! All doctors are really concerned with your well being and your health.  I've never had such a good practice like this.

title: Outstanding Service Beyond Expectations
body: Had surgery done here in the care of spire and the nhs staff. I have received an exceptional service. I would recommned this hospital one hundred percent.

title: Flu jab
body: I found the whole experience of the flu vaccination program well organised, efficient and a painless experience. Communication via txt message is a particularly good reminder.

title: Great practice
body: Always found Doctors Nurses and reception helpfull polite, i see people leaving reviews saying worst practice ever. i have heard people at reception shouting complaining about nothing think about the job these people have to do and what they put up with,so before you put a review here,think about it and in some cases grow up,and if its so bad go elsewhere and see if its any better.

title: Excellent practice
body: This year the flu vaccination was easy and swift with no holdups or complications. The centre where the vaccinations was easy to find and disabled parking right outside

title: Flu Clinic
body:
Very pleased with the surgery and staff 
Well run and pleasant and helpful staff and doctors
Flu Clinic was very well organised from start to finish

title: Rude and unhelpful staff
body:
No appointments are availible to those who work and the receptionist was rude enough to imply that if I need the doctors that bad I shouldn't be working!! 

Reception claim you cannot book appointments in advance and only offer appointments on the day if you can get through at 8am!

5 mins in to my telephone appt I was asked to attend surgery only to sit waiting in an empty surgery for 30 mins and then for the doctor to dissappear on an emergency for 20 mins mid way though the consultation. Staff just need some common care skills and to actually listen to what people are saying! The village surgery - you are also ignoring my request to join your patient review group - I wonder why? I don't feel that one even exists!

title: Speedy and efficient service
body: I was invited to attend for a C.T. scan. There is a mobile C.T. unit in the car park. It is an excellent resource. My appointment was for 3pm. By 3.06pm I was back in my car having had the scan. The staff were lovely and they wee operating a one-in-one-out system to be Covid-19 compliant. I was very impressed.

title: discharge of patients
body: The procedure for discharging patients needs to be dramatically improved. A friend was informed at lunch time that they could leave the hospital after treatment. The waiting time from being informed to actually leaving was over 8 hours . This is totally unacceptable, and the system needs to be improved.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely receptionist
body: I rang the surgery today as needed help for a relative. I spoke to a really lovely receptionist who was so helpful. She listened, was supportive and showed compassion. I can’t remember her name but she is a credit to the surgery. Thank you

title: Impressed
body:
Thank you to the team for such an efficient and helpful response to my online contact.
Reassuring in these challenging times!

title: Flu Clinic
body: Awesome! Incredibly efficient & well coordinated. Highly impressed with everyone involved in running the flu clinic 09-10-2020. Super service. Thank you for your immense service of care to us in these dire times. You are amazing!

title: Person centred practice
body: I have been a patient here for years and they have always been wonderful. They think outside the box and bend over backwards to help. Too many examples to mention but including thorough testing resulting in diagnosis and treatments that changed my life. I feel very lucky to have them as my GP

title: Top quality care
body: I visited with a minor eye injury and was treated almost immediately by two very helpful and knowledgeable nurse practitioners.  All the staff I encountered from Reception onwards couldn't have been more helpful or caring.  I can't recommend this centre and its team more highly.

readBy.name: Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Fantastic practice
body: Overwhelmed by the way my flu jab was done this morning , 2 lovely ladies to greet me , directed to reception where another friendly lady took my name then straight in to have my injection by yet another great nurse whom I have seen many times due to my COPD , the whole procedure took only 8 mins and also got a phone appointment to review my COPD . What can I say except a huge thank you to all those at WHS where I have been going to since approx 1965 . Always had marvellous care from everyone and not forgetting the fab receptionists who have always been kind and understanding ,the Pharmacists who cope with my many cock ups when ordering , Friends of Wendover who have been so helpful and not forgetting the persons who keep our surgery clean ,So WHS my heartfelt thanks to you all, stay safe ..... now wash your hands lol xx

title: Unhelpful Reception Staff!
body:
I usually do not leave a bad review but, I am very concerned the way receptionist made no effort to help me with my query of medication that I take for years! I had ordered my meds via a chemist on Wednesday afternoon this week, so in theory I should have received my meds on Friday, ready to be picked up at the chemist. However, my meds were not at the chemist at 5.30pm.  So I contacted the receptionist, after explaining, I was told the prescription is not signed, even though 48hrs notice was provided.  I asked her if she could try and sort the prescription for me as the GP has look at it and send it via EPS as I have none left, but she cut me off and said "No, usually you have to give us 48hrs notice". She further stated, my prescription will not be ready until Monday.  I tried explaining a notice was served. In reply she said she can't  do anything  about it. She did not display any courtesy or understand of my needs! I now am left without any meds for the weekend.  I am very concerned and worried the decision the receptionists are allowed  to make without consulting the clinicians.  

I understand the pressure the GPs and their staff are under at present time, but even though going by the rules of 48hrs notice, I still did not get my medication.  I find this appalling service and dangerous practice for those patients who may live on medications. 

I hope the practice remind their staff of their duties of listening, being helpful, caring and understanding.

title: 8 years a patient
body:
Had many reasons to visit practice for me and immediate family members. 

Apart from delays sometimes in getting appointment (which is common across all surgeries) I feel I have received good medical attention. My only concern would be referrals which sometimes need a bit of an extra persuasion.

title: Blood tests
body:
Can your staff inform patients they can no longer have their blood tests done in the same building as the clinic and at the same time inform them where they are to go for their blood tests.
 many thanks.

title: Felt safe at flu jab clinic during pandemic.
body:
The clinic have been running flu jab sessions in the local church hall. When I visited I was so impressed with the choice of venue which allowed for a one way system and ample space. The staff were protected, they stuck to appointment times so there was no queue at all and they had all doors propped open so I didn't have to touch the handles. The letter we received in advance explained what was expected of us, including wearing masks. 
The staff were welcoming and the whole experience was stress free. 
Well done to the team at Coppull Medical Practice.

title: Non-existent prescription service
body: This surgery has continued to mess up prescription requests really badly over the last 20 months leaving patients without vital medicines for long periods. Bog-standard repeat prescriptions are currently taking 2 weeks with many chase-ups.  It is very worrying as there are far too many patients and they just can’t seem to cope with basic services & never apologise for their mistakes & sloppiness.  The medical staff are good  but the office function is really poor.

title: Thank you!
body:
I rarely need an emergency appointment, but have always managed to get one when needed. I have to praise the staff particularly both doctors for all the kindness, patience and understanding with myself over the last few years, especially over the last few months when I have had serious problems with my mental health ( I must thank the reception staff for realising that o was in need of help urgently).  Both doctors were very patient and kind and listened. I have spoken with the same doctor for about 6 months now, and he is always patients and sympathetic and has never once made me feel rushed when talking, taking as much time as was needed. He involved me in all the decisions regarding my treatment. I can say that with his help and the medication I am genuinely feeling much better, I am not yet ‘back to myself’ but I am going in the right direction, from being on the verge of a nervous breakdown to being back at work, enjoying it again, being able to spend time with my family Again properly. I am honestly very very grateful. The difference it was 
made is amazing. 
I have always found the surgery very good, especially as I work on healthcare alongside GPs surgerys 5 days a week - I know a good doctors surgery when I see one! I am surprised at the negative feedback and in my experience it seems unfair! Especially as the complaints seems to be over lack of appointment availability, which is the same for EVERY GP surgery in the county. 
Thank you again for all your help and support, especially at such a challenging time when I see increased pressure. God bless x

title: supberb
body:
What a wonderful hospital ive had breast cancer twice 2nd  time having to lose my breast. But the. Care and the treatment was wonderful from everyone 
From cleaners and porters nursing  staff and docters I fell lucky that I was treated at this hospital thankfully ive just been given the all clear had I paid a million pounds I could not of  been treated better thank you nhs

title: Well run
body:
Quickest flu jab for me. In and out, felt very safe and it was run very well
The staff made sure that social distancing was kept and one way system was very clever and worked well

title: Very kind and reassuring staff.
body: I attended the clinic for a hysteroscopy and felt very nervous as the last one that I had in another hospital had to be done under general anaesthetic, so I had not really known anything about it! I cannot thank the doctor and two nurses enough. They could not have been kinder. They were very reassuring and patient throughout the procedure and constantly checked that I felt OK to continue. At some point in the near future, I have to return to have some polyps removed, under local anaesthetic but I know that I will be very well looked after.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Good clinical care; poor booking system
body:
It’s very difficult to operate the new on-line booking system. You have to work out who you should be asking to see - normally a doctor but sometimes not - and then navigate your way through loads of questions including stuff like “do you want a telephone appointment or face to face”. The only correct answer of course is “I don’t know, you’re the doctors not me”.  But there isn’t a field for that. 

If you do get through all this - and I bet many vulnerable or elderly people don’t - you then get offered a consultation by phone or face to face. In this case it was face to face. 

I arrived on time but the medical professional was running late. Nobody told me that - under the old system they would have. Eventually I was seen and the individual appeared to me to be extremely professional. She asked all the questions I would have expected, examined me (both wearing masks) and I think she correctly identified the problem. She has prescribed me exercises which appear to be working. She also wants me to see a physio, but no one has been in touch about this, so I’m not sure what to do about it. 

The other thing that is bizarre about this practice’s IT system is that you often get text messages from doctors, but there is no means of replying. So you are left wondering what to do, and often end up starting the system over again and making an appointment, when all you needed was an exchange of text messages to resolve the issue. Seems a waste of scarce NHS resources.

title: Excellent Care
body:
On arrival to the hospital I felt very appreciative.
The Nursing staff on Ward 1 and the Theatre Team soon made me feel less anxious, with their kindness and caring approach.
They listened to my concerns and acted to resolve those concerns.
Thank you for looking after me so well.
Your all doing a brilliant job in very difficult times.

title: Great surgery experience.
body:
I attended at 8.15. Made very welcome and safe. No waiting. All staff relaxed and happy.
All in all a good experience

title: season Flu Jab
body: Just left the practice after my annual flu vaccination and want to say a huge thank you to every staff member on duty this morning. Really efficient system set up and I was in and out in under 5 minutes. Once again thank you to all concerned and an extra 👍 for the polite and happy disposition of all the staff on this cold, wet and dreary Saturday

title: Excellent Flu Clinic
body: I attended a Sat flu clinic at the Brockwell GP practice, which was extremely well organised. Staff to greet patients, take their temperature and check us in to reception. Had jab within one minute and out via seperate exit. Safety of patient's their priority, well organised and orchestrated. Thanks to all staff involved for their care and kindness. Saw them specially helping elderly couple who were struggling to walk. Exceptional care.

title: Friendly professionally run practice
body:
Went for my annual flu vaccine  took longer to park the car than the jab itself ! Greeted at door,asked to read the Covid questions, then inside name checked out by a member of staff. Asked to go to a particular room and was guided there. Nurse waiting, greeted by christian name and vaccine administered. Exited by another door and that was it, thought it
a very well organised operation undertaken in the circumstances we live in today.

title: Brilliant service
body: I had my flu jab this morning. The staff were just wonderful. A large number of dedicated staff on duty, guiding me through the process.  The whole routine was so well planned and managed; I cant imagine a method, in these days of Covid, that could be better or safer. I was in, done and out in a matter of a few minutes.  The local community is fortunate to be served by this Practice and these people.

title: Flu vaccination
body: Attended for the annual flu vaccination which this year was under covid conditions Found it was very well organised with staff directing you through the surgery The staff were all very friendly and the whole process was excellent Well done Yelverton Surgery

title: Flu clinic - military precision!
body: Just had my flu jab and the clinic was so well organised - Marshalls outside and at the door, straight into a room and out the one way system. Literally took minutes and felt very safe with social distancing. Great effort to get all the community protected 👍

title: Flu Injection
body: My visit to the practice for a flu injection was exceptionally well organised with everyone polite and helpful.

title: Flu Jab
body: Despite being called every year for a flu jab, I’m asthmatic, this was my first vaccination. With the current situation there was never going to be a better time to take the practice up on their offer. This morning, as usual, everything was well organised with every precaution in place. My nurse was super friendly and explained the side effects I could expect being a flu jab newby.

title: Excellent service
body: I attended for the flu jab today, excellent service quick, and a well thought out programme. 10/10 I have no issues with telling other people about the service.

title: Efficient and helpful
body: A good team at the Meads - from the receptionist to the clinical staff I had a very positive experience and the appointment process and advice and treatment from the Doctors was excellent

title: organised practice
body:
Went for Flu Jab, felt secure and well looked after. All staff were cheerful and wearing PPE. In the front door and out the back door.
Well done all.

title: Flu Vaccine
body: Very well organised with staff giving a warm welcome and clear instructions to follow the one way system in order to receive our vaccines. Very efficient way to manage this important yearly vaccine  whilst keeping to COVID-19 regulations. I was not rushed and was treated with respect and kindness. Thankyou .

title: Flu Clinic
body: Visited the surgery today for my Flu jab. An extremely well organised clinic. After a friendly greeting at the door, we were given clear instructions, social distancing was carefully observed by staff, no queuing we were sent straight to a waiting practitioner, jab done and excited on a one way system. In and out in less than five minutes. Excellent service - well done team!

title: Good experience
body: I find this surgery very organised and informative they are very patient and they take the time to listen and it shows that they genuinely care about there patients and everyone I have had an experience with has been extremely polite and understanding

title: Flu jab fiasco
body: Getting my flu jab 10/10/20...a fiasco which looked like it was organised by the "writers of carry on nurse" but this was not funny! More like a scene from a film about the apocolypse!

title: Great Medical Attention
body: Urinating blood on Monday. Rang health centre. Sample required. Sent in sample which was tested immediately. Doctor rang back to say the sample would be sent to lab. that day and results on Thursday. In meantime perscription sent to chemist who actioned on Monday so that a course of anti biotics could commence. Doctor rang back early Thursday morning with lab results which showed no urinary infection. Doctor decided to refer me to my Urology Consultant at Airedale but needed a blood test first which was arranged at the health centre on Thursday thanks to great flexibility by the practice nurse. On Friday the Urology Dept at Airedale rang to talk and to advise on next actions. All in all showing the NHS at its very best.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Flu vaccine
body: My wife and I had our flu jabs today, and would like to congratulate the medical team. The whole operation was very well organised, quick and efficient, and felt very safe. Thank you to all those involved.

title: Great Practice
body: Visited for flu jab.... everybody wonderful and extremely welcoming and helpful... thank you everyone...

title: Fantastic treatment received from all staff…
body:
Could only choose one category but this review is for 

Accident & Emergency
Children’s/Paediatric ward

My little boy recently had to stay in hospital due to breathing difficulties.

An ambulance was sent to us and the paramedics that came were both brilliant with my son who has additional needs. Both of the the paramedics were friendly, kind and caring and were great at reassuring us in what was a very anxious situation. It was decided it would be too distressing for my son to be taken by ambulance to hospital but I was provided with the paperwork I would need as well as being reassured that if anything were to happen on my way to hospital, an ambulance would be available to help if need be. 

When arriving at Pilgrim A&E we were dealt with by a lovely, friendly receptionist. 
We were quickly seen and taken through to a cubicle for my little boy to be assessed and have tests. Each nurse and doctor encountered during this were fantastic - they were friendly and caring towards both my son and I, and I felt very confident in what they were doing to help my son. 
Whilst waiting to be taken up to the children’s ward, one of the paramedics that had assisted us earlier popped in to see my son to check how he was doing which was a lovely surprise and I thank him for being so thoughtful and as before he was very kind and reassuring. 

We were taken to to the children’s ward and ended up having to stay in overnight as my son needed oxygen. 
As with all the previous staff members I had met, the nurses and doctors on the children’s ward were all wonderful as were the lovely ladies who brought us drinks and cleaned our room. 
I am honestly so so grateful to all of the team for not only making my son better, but for being so lovely to us throughout. It made what was a tough situation much easier to deal with. 
Even little things like bringing me a phone charger, and a compact DVD player with my son’s favourite film were so helpful and meant so much. 

I cannot thank the staff enough - they were the loveliest paramedics, nurses, doctors & housekeeping staff I have ever encountered in a hospital. 

Thank you once again, you are all brilliant and are very much appreciated! Hopefully this feedback is passed on :)

title: Unbelievably brilliant service
body:
I came to the breast clinic this morning because I had found a lump.
In the space of one hour I had been seen and examined by a doctor, had a mammogram, an ultrasound and a biopsy and was discharged home feeling reassured and happy.
I was so impressed with the efficiency of the whole system. All the staff that looked after me were kind and professional.
What a brilliant service you all provide.
Thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly practice and professional
body: Today I had a flu jab and found the experience to be relaxed and informative. The organisation was spot on with helpful, friendly staff throughout.Totally professional and stress free.

title: Brilliant practice, wonderful team
body: This surgery have continued to provide their excellent level of service, despite such challenging times. The children’s vaccination clinic was an example of such great care - the team not only put my three-year-old at ease - but then gave her a bravery certificate which she carried around all day, and took to show and tell at nursery. She even said afterwards she liked going to have her injections - a first! Many thanks indeed for all your great work

title: Flu Shot
body: Extremely well organised and efficient. In and out quickly. All explained to me. Felt very safe. Well done

title: Exellent organising of flu jab
body: My wife and I decided to do the drive through flu jab. We were a little sceptical but were greeted by very friendly staff and we were given exact directions and knew exactly where to park. Excellent organisation very well done indeed we were only about 3 minutes.

title: Fantastic flu clinic
body: Mitcheldean surgery are just so efficient, flu line dedicated to booking your appointment, no queue on arrival and the efficient nurse gives you the injection with a little chat and you are on the way. We were nearly home before our appointment time. Always brilliant no change. Thanks

title: Flu jab
body: Just had flu jab in tent well set up very efficient ladies on duty very polite quick,easy took barely two minutes, job done !!

title: How to feel looked after
body:
This is a practice where you feel you are known to all there and you feel looked after. Everyone who works there are friendly and helpful and treats you with respect. 
My only hope is that this is a practice who are able to keep their personal touch as the practice has a good GP number ratio which enables good quality!

title: health treatment in a 5 star hotel!!!!
body: Angels in blue who can not do enough for there patients, Nothing is too much trouble. so much help and reassurance in a difficult time. I wish to thank from the bottom of my heart everyone that had anything to do with me. I OWE my life to you and the NHS.

title: Excellent organisation
body: I have just had my flu vaccination today and I just wanted to congratulate the practice and thank all the staff today.  The proceedure was so well organised and the staff were so friendly and welcoming.  I'm sure the whole proceedure from arrival to being back in my car was no more than 10 minutes, and as it was a cold morning and there was already a queue I imagined I would be queuing for hours.  So thank you to all involved for making an experience much better than I envisioned.

title: Great service for receiving the Flu vaccination
body:
I came to the surgery to receive the flu vaccination and the way they had set the clinic up was excellent. 
Well organised, Service was fast, running on time, felt safe and very efficient

title: Caring, considerate and kind
body: During Lockdown the practice made sure that I was properly supported, as I am being treated for cancer and therefore more vulnerable. I needed regular blood tests so they made sure the Community Phlebotomist came to me, thus ensuring I could stay at home. The weekly food parcels they ensured I received were much appreciated and meant I did not have to go to the shops. Always courteous, they are also kind and considerate and have never made me feel I do not matter or that they are too busy.

title: Very organised
body: Just had a very organised and safe flu jab. Well done to the clinic staff. Communication during pandemic has also been very good.

title: Rudeness by staff
body: Called the practice to chase up my grandmas anticipatory medication twice today. I then called again and the receptionist told me there’s nothing she can do about it, I then said again the hospice has sent over an email and she told me the doctor can’t work with something that isn’t there. It was around tea time and the surgery was nearly closed as you can appreciate this isn’t something minor and needed sorting that day. The hospice then had to phone and it was sorted immediately. The way the receptionist spoke to me was disgusting and made me feel like I didn’t know what I was speaking about. Me and my family did not need the stress of her phone manor.

title: 5star practice
body: Went for a flu jab today with my husband we arrived 8.30.exited 8.31 all done it was so fast and painless excellent doctors and staff well done and many thanks from us both

title: Lovely nurse
body: I went for smear test which is obviously not the best of experiences, however the nurse performed tge proceedure with such care it was actually quite a pleasant experience. Very caring lady.

title: Impressed
body: I have just been for my flu jab at St Luke's Primary Care Centre.  and was very impressed with the organisation.  Everything was clearly signed, there were lots of helpful staff around and I was sanitised, in, vaccinated and out in less than 5 minutes.  Thank you.

title: Great Flu Vaccination Clinic
body:
A very well organised and friendly walk-through flu vaccination clinic this morning.

As usual, all the staff were friendly and helpful and I've always been very happy with the service for the 25 years

title: Brilliant Service
body: I phoned 111 for advice and he sent an ambulance out which arrived within half an hour. Paramedics were excellent and took me to hospital. I was straight into A & E and seen by a Doctor and nurse within twenty minutes. Thankfully my tests were okay and I was discharged but the whole experience was made as easy as possible. Thank goodness for our NHS.

title: Great Practice
body: Even though they are not doing face to face appointments at the moment, phone call appointments are just as good, the Doctors are really helpful

title: Great Staff
body: I have just been and had my annual flu jab, this year at the Methodist church, I waited less than a minute to be seen, and within a minute I was back in the street. The nurse was extremely pleasant but still acted professionally. A big thank you to all King George staff, during this difficult time. You are always cheerful and respectful to your patients.
